intro: Barbacenia fanniae, commonly known as the Fannia's barbacenia, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that typically feature vibrant red or orange petals. Barbacenia fanniae thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained, nutrient-rich soil. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
